Contributor.Department: C.S. Mott Center for Human Growth and Development
Contributor.Organization: Wayne State University School of Medicine

Sample.Title: Placenta, Female, Benzene, rep1 [B5L1]

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: C57B/l6 mice were exposed to 50ppm benzene for 5 hours a day from E0.5 to E17.5. Tissues were collected on E17.5
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was harvested using Rneasy mini plus kit (Qiagen). 1.3 ug of total RNA was used for the construction of sequencing libraries. RNA libraries for Placental RNA-seq were prepared using NEBNext Ultra II RNA Library Prep Kit following manufacturer's protocols. RNA libraries for Decidua RNA-seq were prepared using Lexogen QuantSeq 3' mRNA-Seq FWD with UDI 12 nt (Unique Dual Indexing) kit according to manufacturer's protocols.

Sample.Data-Processing: Base calling was conducted using HiSeq Control Software (placenta) or NovaSeq Control Software (decidua), converted to fastq files and de-multiplexed using Illumina bcl2fastq 2.17 software Sequence reads were trimmed for adaptor sequence/low-quality sequence using Trimmomatic v.0.36 (Placenta) or BBDUK from BBMap package v.38.90 (Decidua) Trimmed sequence reads were mapped to GRCm38/mm10 using STAR aligner v.2.5.2b Read count extraction was performed using Subread package v.1.5.2 (Placenta) or HTSeq-count v.2.0.1 (Decidua) Read count normalization was performed using DESeq2 package (Placenta) or edgeR (Decidua) Assembly: mm10 Supplementary files format and content: tab-delimited text files include raw count values for each sample

Series.Title: Intrinsic sexual dimorphism in the placenta determines the differential response to benzene exposure
Series.Summary: To investigate the impact of benzene exposure during pregnancy on the placenta and fetal development
Series.Overall-Design: C57/BL6 mice were exposed to 50ppm benzene for 5 hours a day from E0.5 to E17.5. Tissues were collected on E17.5
Series.Type: Expression profiling by high throughput sequencing
